FacilityName: Seaport Midstream Partners LLC - Seattle Terminal

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Seaport Midstream Partners LLC Seattle Terminal



RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Seaport Midstream Partners LLC (SMP) Terminal in Seattle, WA is committed to providing a safe work environment for employees/contractors and to being a responsible corporate citizen. SMP believes that excellent performance in the areas of health, environment, safety and security goes hand-in-hand with operational excellence and financial success. In fulfilling this commitment, SMP will comply with regulatory requirements and provide and maintain a safe working environment using acceptable and proven business practices. All Seattle Terminal employees will strive to identify and eliminate hazards which could result in injury and illness, damage to the environment, property damage, and security losses.



The Seattle Terminal is operated and maintained in a manner that protects the environment, as well as the health and safety of its employees, contractors and the community in which it operates. SMP promotes health, safety, and the environment through programs of awareness, compliance, prevention and protection. These programs include a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning. This summary provides a brief overview of the risk management activities that the Seattle Terminal has designed and implemented.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



Seaport Midstream Partners LLC - Seattle Terminal is a light products, bulk petroleum storage facility used in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the vicinity of Seattle, Washington. The Terminal handles and stores various grades of unleaded gasoline, low-sulfur diesel, renewable fuels (i.e. ethanol, biodiesel, etc.) and additives. The Seattle Terminal complies with Process Safety Regulations in the covered process which encompasses Butane unloading, Butane storage vessels, pumps and associated piping. Butane is stored in two vessels and transferred to/blend

ed with gasoline through the use of a fixed piping system and injection skid.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS



SMP's accidental release prevention programs and emergency planning and response programs help us effectively manage the hazards posed by the site's regulated substances to employees, the public, and the environment. The covered process is regulated by the EPA RMP regulation 40 CFR Part 68 and the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard 29CFR 1910.119 along with Washington State OSHA (WAC Title 296-67-xxx). The following accident prevention programs are in place or currently being modified at the Seattle Terminal:



1) Employee Participation

2) Process Safety Information

3) Process Hazard Analysis (PHA)

4) Standard Operating Procedures

5) Operator Training

6) Contractors

7) Pre-startup Safety Review

8) Mechanical Integrity

9) Hazardous Work Authorization

10) Management of Change

11) Incident Investigation

12) Emergency Procedures

13) Compliance Audits

14) Trade Secrets



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no accidents within the past five (5) years.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The Seattle Terminal Emergency Response Plan provides the essential planning and training for protecting employees, the public, and the environment during emergency situations. Contained within the Plan are written procedures that outline the actions to be taken for various types of emergencies that could occur in the facility. These emergencies may include: airborne releases of chemical substances, spills to the water or ground, fires, explosions, personnel medical emergencies. Process worst case and alternate release scenarios have been evaluated inclusive of off-site consequence analyses.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



SMP is continually striving to make the Seattle Terminal the safest and most reliable workplace possible for its employees, neighbors and community. The Facility's focus is safe, reliable, and environmentall

y sound operations. The goal of the Seattle Terminal is to demonstrate continuous improvement in our health, environmental and safety performance. In addition, SMP will work cooperatively with its neighbors to ensure the health, environment, safety and security of the Seattle Terminal and surrounding community.
